articles.title: Revelations from 17-million-year-old ape teeth could lead to new insights on early human evolution - The Conversation
articles.description: Cutting-edge analysis of fossil ape teeth reveals ancient seasonal change in Africa, long before human ancestors appeared. The method will be crucial for the future study of early hominins.
articles.content:
The timing and intensity of the seasons shapes life all around us, including tool use by birds, the evolutionary diversification of giraffes, and the behaviour of our close primate relatives.
